## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [binTableColumn(table, column)](./arquero.bintablecolumn.md) | This function takes an arquero table and bins the values of a specified column into a fixed set of quantiles from 0-1.0. // TODO: use op.ntile?? |
|  [chain(table, functions)](./arquero.chain.md) | Apply a list of functions to a table in series, returning the final output. Helper because Arquero does not have something akin to d3's <code>call</code>. |
|  [checkAndAddChildCount(main)](./arquero.checkandaddchildcount.md) | This checks the main table for community.childCount column and computes if missing |
|  [checkAndAddNodeCount(main)](./arquero.checkandaddnodecount.md) | This checks the main table for a community.nodeCount column and computes if missing |
|  [columnTypes(table)](./arquero.columntypes.md) |  |
|  [filterEdgesToNodes(edges, nodes)](./arquero.filteredgestonodes.md) | Filters an edge list to only include connections between the nodes in the provided collection |
|  [findGroupIndices(table, field, value)](./arquero.findgroupindices.md) |  |
|  [findNodesCollectionForCommunity(cid, byParent, byCommunity)](./arquero.findnodescollectionforcommunity.md) |  |
|  [findNodesTableForCommunity(cid, byParent, byCommunity)](./arquero.findnodestableforcommunity.md) | Gets a table of just the nodes for a matching community. The preferred outcome here is to use the grouped-by-parent table, because this retains child community differentiability. However, if the selected community is a leaf in the hierarchy, it will have no child communities and therefore filtering by 'parent' will not return it (because there are no rows with this cid as parent). In this case, we use the grouped-by-community variant to get the nodes. |
|  [findNodesTableForParent(pid, byParent)](./arquero.findnodestableforparent.md) | Find all of the node rows for communities that share a parent. |
|  [getColumnHistogram(table, name)](./arquero.getcolumnhistogram.md) |  |
|  [getColumnStats(table, name)](./arquero.getcolumnstats.md) |  |
|  [getEdgesFromTableByID(selectedId, nodeTable, edges)](./arquero.getedgesfromtablebyid.md) |  |
|  [getNodeStats(table, quantile)](./arquero.getnodestats.md) | Gets default rolled up node stats within a quantile range. |
|  [getPrecision(domain, values)](./arquero.getprecision.md) |  |
|  [hasColumn(table, column)](./arquero.hascolumn.md) |  |
|  [initializeCommunityTable(table)](./arquero.initializecommunitytable.md) |  |
|  [initializeEdgeTable(table)](./arquero.initializeedgetable.md) |  |
|  [initializeJoinTable(table)](./arquero.initializejointable.md) |  |
|  [initializeNodeTable(table, fromEdges)](./arquero.initializenodetable.md) | Take a starter node table and ensure it has all the required columns (or default values) |
|  [joinDataTables(left, right, type, leftKey, rightKey)](./arquero.joindatatables.md) | Join a new table to existing, using strict rules of id and prefix. I.e., this is not a general-purpose join util, but rather one that simplifies our joins by assuming an id column and a prefix for output columns. |
|  [joinNodeCommunityTables(nodes, communities)](./arquero.joinnodecommunitytables.md) |  |
|  [joinWithReplace(left, right, joinDefinition)](./arquero.joinwithreplace.md) | Simple join that replaces any columns in the left with matching columns in the right. Normal arquero behavior is the rename collisions, but we have so much dependence on expected columns that this causes problems. It's especially frequent because the join keys are renamed, so this lets us join and exclude the key |
|  [listColumnDefinitions(table, readOnlyNames)](./arquero.listcolumndefinitions.md) | Create a set of ColumnDefs by enumerating the table. Optional set of column names indicating they are read-only (i.e., not deletable in UI) TODO: this should reside in the webapp |
|  [listColumnNames(table)](./arquero.listcolumnnames.md) |  |
|  [normalizeXY(table)](./arquero.normalizexy.md) |  |
|  [one(table, transformer)](./arquero.one.md) | Extracts the objects from a single-row table. This is commonly needed when doing rollups that output a single row of stats. |
|  [recomputeCommunityStats(table, force)](./arquero.recomputecommunitystats.md) |  |
|  [rename(table, prefix, exclude)](./arquero.rename.md) | Return a selection mapping that renames columns with a prefix. |
